solution_line_template: First, if the a full tire needs {tire_capacity} cubic inches of air, then two empty tires need: {tire_capacity} cubic inches/tire * {num_empty_tires} tires = <<{tire_capacity}*{num_empty_tires}={empty_tires_air_needed}>>{empty_tires_air_needed} cubic inches.

So, we find the 40%-full tire needs {tire_capacity} cubic inches * ({tire_40_needed_percent}%) = <<{tire_capacity}*({tire_40_needed_percent}*{percent_factor})={tire_40_air_needed}>>{tire_40_air_needed} cubic inches.

So, the 70%-full tire needs {tire_capacity} cubic inches * ({tire_70_needed_percent}%)= <<{tire_capacity}*({tire_70_needed_percent}*{percent_factor})={tire_70_air_needed}>>{tire_70_air_needed} cubic inches.

Now add up the needs of all the tires to find the total number of cubic inches needed: {empty_tires_air_needed} cubic inches + {tire_40_air_needed} cubic inches + {tire_70_air_needed} cubic inches = <<{empty_tires_air_needed}+{tire_40_air_needed}+{tire_70_air_needed}={total_air_needed}>>{total_air_needed} cubic inches.
Finally, if the pumps each hold {pump_capacity} cubic inches, the total number of pumps needed is {total_air_needed} cubic inches / {pump_capacity} cubic inches/pump = {pumps_needed} pumps.
